general_advisory: Due to low temperature, apply thin layer of dry FYM on nursery to maintain the temperature. Start sowing the summer crops when the temperature is conducive for germination.

advisory: Collect and sow Mung varieties IPM-02-14 (65 days), IPM-02-3 (65 days), PDM-11 (65 days), PDM-54 (60 to 65 days), Durga (60 to 65 days), Samrat (65 to 70 days), K-851 (60 to 65 days) and Blackgram varieties - Sarla (65 to 70 days), PU-31 (70 days), PU-30 (65 to 70 days), PU-35 (65 to 70 days), PU-19 (65 to 70 days) etc.
Treat seeds with Carbendazim @ 2 g/kg of seeds before sowing
Treat seeds with rizobium culture @ 20g per kg of seeds prior to sowing
Transplant 10-12 days old seedlings on the main field
Apply 200 grams of mustard oil or til oil per quintal to reduce moth infestation
Transplant seedlings in 20cm X 10 cm spacing when 3 weeks old
Apply 24:12:12 kg NPK per acre if soil is not tested
Apply 8 kg Nitrogen per acre when maize crop is 2-3 weeks old
Go for intercultivation and earthing up work when maize crop is 2-3 weeks old
Apply 8 kg Nitrogen per acre
Apply gypsum at sowing @ 50kg/acre or 100 kg broadcast per acre
Irrigate at crown root initiation and jointing stage
Apply 8 kg Nitrogen per acre in early sown crop
Apply 6-8 kg nitrogen per acre at 25-30 days after sowing
Thinning operation at 25-30 days after sowing
Go for intercultivation and earthing up in delayed sown crop
Apply remaining nitrogen fertilizer of 30 kg/acre
Manage Leaf blight with Mancozeb application
Manage Brinjal Foot & Shoot borer with Neem based pesticides
Ventilate the shed well
Use sand on the shed floor for cleanliness
Feed high-energy fiber foods in winter
Balance coldness of water with lime application
Reduce food quantity due to low temperature for fish digestion ease
Administer furasil in water for 3 days
Administer Lasota vaccine within 7 days for chicken rabies control
